postcontent:
Yes, this is the real deal.  Well, mostly it is.  What we have here is a genuine Redhead beauty from the Russian Glory Days.  A 1941 Tula Original-Built Sniper SVT-40!  

When I bought the rifle a while back I had no idea SVT sniper's existed until I posted it to the GunBoards.  They inform ed me quickly and confirmed that it is a Factory-Made 1941 Tula SVT-40 Sniper and I better treat her with care, and so I did!  I vigorously searched high and low to return her to her glory days, but after seeing that an original mount fetches $2,000 in U.S.A. and that there are more fakes that genuine examples here, I bought a reproduction mount for her.  Next on the list was a true scope, no repro would suffice here.  I got in contact with a nice fella from Ukraine, where he found me an all Original FED-built SVT-40 1941 Scope!  This setup is how she sits now, as an extremely rare and fine example of Russian, WWII, Sniper, and Semi-Auto History.

This example underwent the typical Russian refurbishment and received the accidental plum bolt, electro-pencil matched everything, and a special extra as far as the stock goes.  Mostly all SVT-40's when coming out of refurbishment were placed into a new AVT-40 stock, which had thicker and stronger wood design do to the Automatic 54r nature of the AVT.  The example I got was an even more limited number of NAVAL AVT-40 stocks, stamped to match the serial and with a rear Mosin-Dog colar escutcheon!  The trigger is that of the original assembly and is struck serial and wider, not the newer-make thinner and electro-pencil versions.

All of the internals match serial, and the rifle comes with an original sling and 2 (TWO) 10rd Box Magazines, original not crappy reproduction! 

The internals are immaculate with no corrosion, including the piston and cup.  I have an SVT-40 tool that will go with the rifle and she performs flawlessly at 1.3 right now.  The bore is a 7 out of 10.

I am selling to buy my fiance' a vehicle asap, my priorities have been changed.  I am open to reasonable offers, but know the true value of this rifle and have priced it as such.
